The project aims at reducing threats to public health through clearance and safe disposal of UXOs, and management of municipal solid waste including construction debris in environmentally sound manner.

donor_name: SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND  COOPERATION OFFICE NEPAL
outputs.output_descr: This project aims to support advanced UN early recovery coordination and interagency programming in the oPt.
Rapid Support to Agriculture and Electricity Sectors funded by Islamic Development Bank.

This project aims to enhance resilience of the Gaza Strip residents through a) the provision of emergency livelihood support targeted at vulnerable groups and b) restoring and maintaining emergency and essential services delivery capacities and actual delivery through Civil Society Organizations (CSOs). The project will also prepare for advanced UN interagency programming, coordination and planning for early recovery through focused monitoring of socio-economic and human development impact of the crisis, early recovery analysis, coordination and setting the stage for early recovery through joint programming. The project will simultaneously provide targeted support to three elements that are directly relevant to the current situation of the targeted population: (1) the livelihood opportunities of households (especially those headed by females), providing immediate support through tangible and quick income generating schemes (2) Address the vulnerability context of special groups of the society (children, women, youth and the disabled) in terms of deteriorating education and health standards, increasing psychosocial problems and limited opportunities for the youth to engage in meaningful activities and (3) Preparing for the recovery stage through early recovery planning and coordination as well as actual programming and delivery of interagency initiatives.

Provide immediate humanitarian relief to internally displaced registered non-refugee Palestinian families whose homes were destroyed in the Gaza Strip through the provision of cash assistance and to strictly compensate Palestinian's in the Gaza Strip for their direct losses as a result of the Israeli military operation which started on 27 December 2008 and lasted until 18 January 2009.

• Quick-impact livelihood support provided to households through enrollment in tangible and quick income generating schemes.
• Essential services capacities maintained and supported through CSOs, addressing vulnerability context of special groups in the areas of education, health and psychosocial healing. 
• Young men and women integrated in meaningful and income generating activities as a means to promote social cohesion and reduce tension and violence.
• Advanced UN interagency programming, coordination and planning for comprehensive early recovery

This project comes as an immediate response of the international community's efforts to restoring the livelihoods of the population of Gaza in the crisis affected areas in Gaza as a result of Israeli cast lead operation during the period of December 26, 2008 - January 18, 2009.
 
On March 31, 2009, the United Nations Development Programme / Programme of Assistance to the Palestinian People (UNDP/PAPP) and Canadian International Development Agency (CIDA) signed an Agreement through which CIDA has entrusted UNDP/PAPP with a grant of CAD 4,000,000 for the implementation of Gaza UXOs and Rubble Removal project.  

The main objective of the project is to reduce the threats on the Gaza population resulting from the existence of UXOs underneath rubble, and safeguarding the environment. The project activities involve deconstruction, collecting and crushing of collected rubble concrete.

UNDP/PAPP as the coordinator of early recovery/environment sub-cluster formulated a Rubble Task Force (RTF) committee aimed at up-scaling agencies' interventions and sharing information in relation to rubble removal activities. The RTF comprises rubble removal actors such as CHF, NRC, UNRWA, and others. The committee convenes every month where each actor provides update on progress, planned activities and challenges. The report covers achieved project targets by these actors according to Joint Action Plan

project_descr: Emergency Supply & Advanced Plan. for Early Recovery-Gaza.  This project aims to support advanced UN ER co.ord. and inter-agency programming, for comprehensive and multi-stakeholders.
project_title: Emergency Supply & Advanced Plan for Early Recovery-Gaza
